Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Tryglysin B (natural AMPs; bacteriocins; Gram-positive bacteria, prokaryotes; XXJ; UCSB1d)
Sequence Information.Source: Streptococcus mutansUA159, human microbiota:mouth, symbiont bacteria

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals this sequence is most similar (85.7%) toTryglysin A.Chemical modification: The side chain of alpha and delta carbons of K6 are fused with the six membered ring of W4 (by forming two C-C bonds) into one additional six-membered aliphatic ring. The peptide Tryglysin was named after the tryptophan, glycine, and lysine amino acids that are involved in the macrocycle.Activity: Tryglysin B inhibited S. ferus DSM 20646 (++), S. mutans UA159 (++), S. sanguinis ATCC 10556 (++), S. gordonii Challis Bt (+), S. mitis CCUG 31611 (++), S. oralis 108 (++), S. pneumoniae D39 (++), S. agalactiae A909 (+), and S. bovis JB1 (+) (note: +, mildly inhibited; ++ inhibited). Reg.7/2021; 6/2023
Literature Information.Author: Rued BE, Covington BC, Bushin LB, Szewczyk G, Laczkovich I, Seyedsayamdost MR, Federle MJ.2021
Literature Information.Title: Quorum Sensing in Streptococcus mutans Regulates Production of Tryglysin, a Novel RaS-RiPP Antimicrobial Compound.
